Package gov.sandia.geotessbuilder

Class Tessellation

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.ArrayList<ArrayList<Triangle>>
gov.sandia.geotessbuilder.Tessellation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<ArrayList<Triangle>>, Collection<ArrayList<Triangle>>, List<ArrayList<Triangle>>, RandomAccess
Direct Known Subclasses:
TessellationPrimary, TessellationRefined
public class Tessellation extends ArrayList<ArrayList<Triangle>>
Tessellation manages a single instance of multi-level tessellation of a unit sphere. Strictly speaking, a tessellation is a single 2D surface that is completely filled with geometric shapes without gaps or overlaps. Using that definition, each level of our multi-level tessellation is a tessellation but we refer to those as 'levels' and reserve the term 'Tessellation' for a multilevel tessellation.

Tessellation is implemented as a 2D array of Triangles where the outer array index spans the levels of the multi-level tessellation and the inner index spans the triangles that reside on each level.

Author:
sballar

  • Method Details

    • populateNodes

      public void populateNodes(int tessLevel) throws GeoTessException
      This method is called after each level of a multi-level Tessellation is assembled. If derived classes wish to populate unpopulated Nodes before construction of the next level of the Tessellation, they can override this method and do that. Derived classes would want to do this if their isDivisble() method requires that Data be assigned to the Nodes before deciding if an Triangle is to be divided.
      Parameters:
      tessLevel - the current tessellation level.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException

    • getVertices

      public ArrayList<Vertex> getVertices()
      Loop over all the levels, triangles and vertices and build a list of the unique Vertex objects in the tessellation. The Triangle and Vertex objects have their indexes set during this process so vertex.get(i).getIndex() will == i.
      Returns:

    • findTriangle

      public Triangle findTriangle(Triangle t, double[] u)
      Perform walking triangle search to find the index of the triangle that contains position defined by vector and which has no descendant.
      Parameters:
      t - the Triangle from which to start the search.
      u - the unit vector representing the position for which to search.
      Returns:
      a reference to the triangle containing the specified position.

    • findTriangle

      public Triangle findTriangle(Triangle t, int tessLevel, double[] u)
      Perform walking triangle search to find the index of the triangle that contains position defined by vector and which resides on the specified tessellation level.
      Parameters:
      t - the Triangle from which to start the search.
      tessLevel - search no higher than this level.
      u - the unit vector representing the position for which to search.
      Returns:
      a reference to the triangle containing the specified position.

    • findTriangle

      public Triangle findTriangle(Triangle t, int tessLevel, double[] u, double[] c)
      Perform walking triangle search to find the index of the triangle that contains position defined by vector and which has no descendant.
      Parameters:
      t - the Triangle from which to start the search.
      tessLevel - search no higher than this level.
      u - the unit vector representing the position for which to search.
      c - a 3-element array that will be filled with the interpolation coefficients.
      Returns:
      a reference to the triangle containing the specified position.

    • findVertex

      public Vertex findVertex(Triangle t, int tessLevel, double[] u, double[] c)
      Search, starting from Triangle t, for a vertex that coincides with supplied unit vector u. Returns null if no such Vertex was found.
      Parameters:
      t -
      u -
      Returns:

    • findVertex

      public Vertex findVertex(double[] u, double[] c)
      Search for a vertex that coincides with supplied unit vector u. Returns null if no such Vertex was found.
      Parameters:
      u - unit vector of vertex to search for
      c - interpolation coefficients (never used).
      Returns:
      Vertex or null if not found

    • testTessellation

      public void testTessellation() throws GeoTessException
      Tests the integrity of the grid. Visits every triangle T, and (1) checks to ensure that every neighbor of T includes T in its list of neighbors, and (2) checks that every neighbor of T shares exactly two nodes with T.
      Throws:
      GeoTessException - if anything is amiss.

    • getInitialSolid

      public InitialSolid getInitialSolid()
      Retrieve the PlatonicSolid that serves as tessellation level zero.
      Returns:
      the PlatonicSolid that serves as tessellation level zero.
